text.paragraph: This section contains a list of completed VA Outpatient Encounters for the patient and a list of Discharge Summaries, Consult Notes, and History & Physical Notes for the patient. The data comes from all VA treatment facilities.

The list of VA Outpatient Encounters shows the 150 most recent Encounter dates within the last 36 months. Each VA Outpatient Encounter may also include several notes with the complete note text. There is a limit of 10 notes for each Encounter. Follow-up visits related to the VA Encounter are not included. The data comes from all VA treatment facilities.

*Chief Complaint: 70 y/o MALE VETERAN WAS SEEN ON JANUARY 9TH WITH AN ENLARGED LYMPH NODE WHICH HAS DOUBLED IN SIZE SINCE THAT TIME. VETERAN HAD BEEN ADVISED TO SEE HIS LOCAL PROVIDER FOR IMMEDIATE ASSISTANCE DR. BEAUCHAMP WHO RECOMMENDED SURGERY WITHIN THE NEXT TWO WEEKS BEFORE IT METASTISES TO OTHER AREAS IN HIS NECK. VETERAN'S DAUGHTER INDICATED THAT DUE TO THE INCREASED COST OF THE SURGERY, IT WILL BE DIFFICULT FOR THEM TO PAY FOR THE SURGERY OUT OF POCKET. SHE WAS INQUIRING ABOUT THE CHOICE PROGRAM AND IF HE WOULD QUALIFY TO USE THIS INSURANCE CARD TO ASSIST WITH THE PAYMENT OF THE SURGERY. SHE CALLED SEVERAL VA PERSONNEL CONCERNING THE CHOICE CARD PROGRAM BUT NEVER OBTAINED A CLEAR ANSWER CONCERNING THIS SITUATION. SHE WAS INFORMED THAT HE NEEDED TO BE SEEN AT THE VA BEFORE HE COULD BE ELIGIBLE FOR THIS PROGRAM. SHE EXPLAINED TO THEM THAT HE HAD BEEN SEEN AND WAS INFORMED THAT HE NEEDED TO SEEK IMMEDIATE EVALUATION AND TREATMENT AS SOON AS POSSIBLE BY HIS PROVIDER. SHE WAS ALSO INFORMED THAT HE NEEDED TO BE PLACED ON A LIST BUT WAS NOT INFORMED OF WHAT KIND OF LIST.SHE IS ASKING FOR ASSISTANCE WITH THIS ISSUE SINCE HIS SURGEON IS INSTRUCTING THEM TO HAVE THIS REMOVED AS SOON AS POSSIBLE. ----------------------------------------------------------- Entered by Elizabeth Rose Collum BSN, RN-BC
Assessment of chief complaint/disposition:Veteran's daughter informed that tap line nurse understands her frustration and the need for immediate care for her father and the difficulty she has had in obtaining the correct answers to her questions concerning this program. She was advised that her concerns would be forwarded to the appropriate personnel for assistance with her urgent concern for her father's health. Progress note forwarded to provider for review: YES
/es/ ELIZABETH R. COLLUM, BSN, RN-BC REGISTERED NURSE Signed: 02/12/2015 10:09
Receipt Acknowledged By: 02/12/2015 16:33 /es/ SCOTT E ANDERSON PHYSICIAN ASSISTANT * AWAITING SIGNATURE * COMPTON,GARY L
02/12/2015 16:27 /es/ RAMAN S. DAMINENI, M.D. STAFF PHYSICIAN
02/12/2015 ADDENDUM STATUS: COMPLETED Dr. Damineni states that if the patient's surgeon recommends surgery, we are to place an urgent consult to surgery clinic in Atlanta, and if they are unable to accommodatethe appointment within two weeks, a Fee Basis consult will need to be submitted.Dr. Damineni asked for the information to be sent to Dr. Salem and to him for further assistance with this concern. Veteran's daughter asked to have the medical records from his local provider fax records urgently to PA Anderson at 706-291-3573. She verbalized understanding and agreed to have them sent as soon as possible.Veteran's daughter called and informed of this information.

MENTAL HEALTH NOTE : LOCAL TITLE: MH PSYCHIATRY GENERAL PROGRESS NOTE STANDARD TITLE: MENTAL HEALTH NOTE DATE OF NOTE: JAN 09, 2015@08:17 ENTRY DATE: JAN 09, 2015@08:17:22 AUTHOR: SHIPMAN,DENISE EXP COSIGNER: URGENCY: STATUS: COMPLETED
CC: Pt. seen for scheduled f/u for evaluation of medication efficacy in the treatment of long H/O Alcohol Dependence, Benzo & Alcohol Amnestic D/O, Recurrent Major Depressive D/O.
HPI: Patient is a 70y/o DWM veteran who reports that he just got out of psych. hospitalization 2 months ago. He was last seen by this provider 12/4/14 and no medication changes were made at that appointment. He reports, "I feel great. I don't think I need any medicine, but I take it 'cause I don't want to upset anybody". Reports he does take the medicine daily. Denies side effects to the current psychotropic medications.
He c/o poor memory. Completed the SLUMS today and he scored 15/30, scoring in the Significantly Imipaired range. Will need to discuss this with patient's daughter.

Influenza Immunization : Influenza Immunization Influenza vaccine given Patient received influenza (inactivated/IIV) vaccine at this visit. The patient has provided verbal CONSENT for the influenza vaccine to be given. Patient was counseled regarding the precautions, risks & benefits of the influenza vaccine. Patient denies contraindications to the influenza vaccine. The education contained in CDC Influenza Vaccine (Inactivated/IIV) Information Statement 2014-2015 (dated 8/19/14) was provided and copy given to patient. CONTRAINDICATIONS: - Severe allergic reaction (e.g. anaphylaxis) to a previous dose or to a vaccine component, including egg protein. PRECAUTIONS: - Persons with moderate or severe acute illnesses (with or without fever) should generally be deferred until the acute illness has improved or resolved. - Some prefilled vaccine syringes and vials include latex which may cause an allergic reaction in latex-sensitive individuals. Always check the package insert for the contents of the product you are using. EDUCATION: - Most people will have no side effects from the vaccine. However, tenderness at the site of the shot may occur and last for several days. Some people will also have fever, chills, headache, or muscle aches within the first 48 hours. - As with any vaccine or drug, the possibility of severe or potentially fatal reactions exists. However, flu vaccine has been rarely associated with severe or fatal reactions. An uncommon illness characterized by ascending paralysis (Guillain-Barre' Syndrome) has been reported following other flu vaccines but not in association with this flu vaccine; however, it must be assumed that the risk is present. Hypersensitivity reactions to any vaccine component can occur. When reported, hypersensitivity has usually consisted of local, delayed-type hypersensitivity reactions (localized swelling and redness). In some instances, people receiving vaccine have had allergic reactions.
The patient was asked if he/she had any questions about the flu or flu vaccine. Pt. seen for minimum of 20 minutes.
CC: Pt. seen for scheduled f/u for evaluation of medication efficacy in the treatment of long H/O Alcohol Dependence, Benzo & Alcohol Amnestic D/O, Recurrent Major Depressive D/O.
HPI: Patient was last seen by this provider 8/5/14 and he was switched to Cymbalta. He needs liver enzymes drawn today before the Cymbalta will be released. He reports he came earlier to get labwork done, "but them people were laughing and cutting up and finally after 20 minutes, I got tired of waiting, so I left". He reports feeling very discouraged and depressed. He continues to report having shaking spells, "and I saw a neurologist, and he said it's nerves with this thing with my girlfriend breaking up with me. Those shaking spells are very embarrassing". He reports he's friends with the waitresses at the Waffle House. "I drive one of them to and from work. She lives in Cartersville. I go up there and do magic tricks and tell jokes for them".
He reports he's starting to feel a little better in terms of anxiety. "Food doesn't taste good, but I've been eating more. I'm not drinking the Ensure since I've been able to get some food down". Reports he's gained #13 in the last several weeks. States, "I can walk without falling and I have more energy".
REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: General- WD/WN thin 70y/o DWM veteran in no acute distress. No fever, chills. Reports his wt. had gone down to 114# "and now my weight is up to #127". Gastrointestinal- Denies nausea when eats. Reports that he can "only eat very small amounts". Denies vomiting. Has gained weight.

He's cooperative and made eye contact with this M.D. Speech is nl in rate, rhythm, volume, and spontaneity. Mood, "I'm depressed, but even that's getting a little better. Patient was counseled regarding the precautions, risks & benefits of the tetanus/diphtheria vaccine. Patient denies any contraindications to the vaccine. The education contained in CDC Tdap Vaccine Information Statement (dated 5/9/13) was provided and copy given to patient. PRECAUTIONS - Serious allergic reaction or other problem with any tetanus and diphtheria vaccine (Td, Tdap or DTaP) - Currently has a moderate or severe illness - If pregnant, must be past the first trimester
EDUCATION - Tetanus is caused by a germ that enters the body through a cut or wound. Tetanus causes serious, painful muscles spasms. - Diphtheria spreads when germs pass from an infected person to the nose or throat of others. Diphtheria causes a thick coating in the nose, throat, or airway, which may cause breathing problems and heart failure. - Pertussis (whooping cough) spreads when germs pass from an infected person to the nose or throat of others. Pertussis causes severe coughing spells, vomiting, and disturbed sleep. It can lead to weight loss, incontinence, rib fractures and passing out from violent coughing. - Almost all people who get Tdap vaccine have no problems from it. - Mild problems, if they occur, usually start within hours to a day or two after vaccination. They may last 1-2 days and include soreness, redness, or swelling where the shot was given. Mild headache or tiredness may also occur. - Serious allergic reaction happen very rarely

6. Please name as many animals as you can in one minute. 0-4 animals = 0 points 5-9 animals = 1 point 10-14 animals = 2 points 15+ animals = 3 points 3/3

She then stopped work and stayed at home to bring up her children. When they were teenagers, she went back to work. She and Jack lived happily ever after.
